detailed_notes: Derived from DEM using terrain() function in Google Earth Engine.
Evapotranspiration (mm/day) from MODIS MOD16A2 dataset.
EVI = 2.5 * (NIR - RED) / (NIR + 6*RED - 7.5*BLUE + 1) using Sentinel-2 bands.
Elevation values in meters derived from the SRTM DEM dataset.
Irrigation = max(0, PEV - TP) estimated from precipitation and potential evapotranspiration.
Total amount of precipitation (rain, snow, etc.) accumulated over a time step.
Amount of water that would evaporate and transpire if sufficient water were available (potential evapotranspiration).
LAI = 3.618 * NDVI - 0.118 (Weiss et al., 2007) calculated from Sentinel-2 NDVI.
NDVI = (NIR - RED) / (NIR + RED) using Sentinel-2 spectral bands.
Plant height proxy derived from Sentinel-1 SAR backscatter measurements (VH, VV polarization).

Diurnal Temperature Range  DTR=Tmax−Tmin ​
VPD = es(T) - ea(Td)   es(T) = 0.6108 * exp(17.27*T/(T+237.3))   (saturation vapor pressure in kPa) ea(Td) = 0.6108 * exp(17.27*Td/(Td+237.3)) (actual vapor pressure in kPa)
Dew Point Temperature at 2 meters (°C)
RH2M stands for Relative Humidity at 2 meters above ground level (%).
WindSpeed = sqrt(u10Â² + v10Â²) (m/s).
Fraction of absorbed photosynthetically active radiation, derived from Sentinel-2 surface reflectance.
Surface skin temperature from ERA5-Land.
Soil Adjusted Vegetation Index.
NDRE = (NIR − RedEdge) / (NIR + RedEdge). Sentinel-2 bands: NIR=B8 (or B8A), Red-Edge=B5/B6/B7. Sensitive to chlorophyll/N status, shown effective for sunflower yield mapping.
CIre = (NIR / RedEdge) − 1 (e.g., B8/B5 − 1). Tracks canopy chlorophyll; robust for stress detection.
RVI = 4·VH / (VV + VH) from calibrated σº VV,VH. Useful SAR proxy for structure/biomass without optical data.
MODIS GPP (500 m) cumulative 8-day product; photosynthetic productivity linked to yield.
VCI = (NDVI_current - NDVI_min) / (NDVI_max - NDVI_min); helpful in monitoring sugarcane health and yield status ResearchGate
Compute from linear backscatter within the harvest window: VV_lin = 10^(VV_dB/10), VH_lin = 10^(VH_dB/10), VV/VH ratio = VV_lin / VH_lin. Useful for canopy structure/moisture.
